title: As Floods Hit, Key Roles Were Vacant at Weather Service Offices in Texas
summary: Some experts say staff shortages might have complicated forecasters’ ability to coordinate responses with local emergency management officials.

title: Texas Flood Victims: What We Know
summary: Child and adult campers and a camp director were among at least 51 people who have died in the flooding in Central Texas.

title: Khamenei Appears in Public for First Time Since Israel War Began
summary: The long absence of Iran’s supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, from public life had fueled speculation about his health and threats to his life.

title: The Cost of Victory: Israel Overpowered Its Foes, but Deepened Its Isolation
summary: It is more secure from threats than at any time since its founding. But the war in Gaza, and attacks on Iran and Lebanon, have undercut Israel’s standing among the world’s democracies.

title: U.S. Turns Eight Migrants Over to South Sudan, Ending Weeks of Legal Limbo
summary: Courts blocked the handover after lawyers raised concerns of torture. Then the Supreme Court intervened to allow the Trump administration’s plan to move forward.

title: Trump Says He Will Start Talks With China on TikTok Deal
summary: President Trump has declined to enforce a statutory ban of the popular social media app while his administration negotiates a deal for an American company to acquire it.

title: How Many Dates Should You Go On Before You Start Talking About Money?
summary: Couples tend to dance around discussing how much they earn or owe early in a relationship. But experts agree that talking about money sooner is better than later.

title: A Lifetime After Fleeing the Nazis, They Tell Their Stories
summary: Thousands of Jewish children fled to Britain and other European countries in the 1938-39 rescue mission known as the Kindertransport. Seven recall their journeys, and what came next.

title: Can Australia Pull Off Barring Children From Social Media?
summary: A law that restricts social media use to people 16 and over goes into effect in December, but much about it remains unclear or undecided.

title: Albert Ojwang Was Killed in Police Custody. Kenyans Are Not About to Let It Go.
summary: At the funeral for Albert Ojwang, protesters in Kenya said his death was a call to action for the country’s youth.

title: The Royal Box: Who’s in Wimbledon’s Most Exclusive Seats?
summary: The event’s most coveted seats are available only through invitation, reserved for celebrities and dignitaries. Here’s a look at who’s sitting in them.

title: A Napoleon From Long Island Meets His Waterloo
summary: An American war re-enactor earned the job of Napoleon for the 210th anniversary of the battle,  despite his accent.

title: Oasis Live Review: The Gallaghers Reunite, Their Songs Still Stomping and Wounds Still Healing
summary: The British band, a showcase for the intoxicating but toxic chemistry of the brothers Liam and Noel Gallagher, performed for the first time in 16 years.

title: Ozzy Osbourne Plays His ‘Final Song’ With Black Sabbath
summary: The metal luminary, 76, took the stage with his original bandmates at a farewell festival in his Birmingham, England, hometown on Saturday night.

title: Girls in Africa Aren’t Asking for Pity. They’re Asking for a Chance.
summary: I went to West Africa to report on girls’ education. I left convinced that the Western feminist movement has grown far too comfortable fighting only for itself.

title: How to Make Better Decisions, According to a Neuroscientist
summary: Making decisions that align long-term goals and short-term rewards is challenging, but it can lead to better choices and richer lives.

title: As a Tourist Influx Makes Prices Soar, Hundreds Protest in Mexico City
summary: The outrage reflects the growing difficulty of affording a city that has become a hot spot for Western immigrants.

title: Elon Musk Says He Will Start a New Political Party
summary: The tech billionaire, who has publicly feuded with President Trump, wrote on social media that he would be creating “the America Party,” though he hadn’t yet filed paperwork.

title: Julian McMahon, ‘Nip/Tuck’ and ‘Fantastic Four’ Star, Dies at 56
summary: He played the half-human, half-demon Cole Turner in the WB supernatural series “Charmed” and a self-destructive playboy in the FX series “Nip/Tuck.”

title: Tropical Storm Warnings Issued in the Carolinas Ahead of Chantal
summary: The storm is expected to move ashore by early Sunday.
